results.title: The French doors
results.creator_credit: Steve Ayson, Liz Garneau and Sam Brunette
results.brief_description: A man is renovating his home and adds a set of French doors to the house. When he wakes the next morning the world has taken a dramatic turn into the unknown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Ayson, Liz Garneau and Sam Brunette

results.title: 15' Zondergrond = 15' Metromania = 15 Metromania
results.creator_credit: Bart Van den Bempt, Karl Huysmans and Bert Hamelinck
results.brief_description: Bernd is the new security guard at the Metro underground. Just as he relaxes into the position, a stern boss dictates some impossible rules and young Bernd’s day goes from bad to worse. Drawing on the aesthetic of the surveillance industry, director Bart Van den Bempt parallels surveillance type images alongside the running plot with split screens. As Bernd, infatuation by a young woman, tracks her movements using the security cameras, we the audience tour the process of security camera surveillance. The film style and structure become bound to the processes of surveillance, whilst the process of surveillance informs the film structure (specifically the narrative and the editing style).

results.title: Substantial shadows
results.brief_description: An elegant, silent meditation on different light forms as they emerge from and transform different obscure, shadowy environments. A miner’s torch flickers across the walls of a cave, a candle flame flickers in a shadow dance, a bonfire blazes in the darkness, a trail of artificial lights illuminate a kitsch architectural structure. Creating a montage that takes its rhythms from the waxing and waning motions of the different light sources Austrian artist Lisl Ponger proposes a playful and poetic contemplation of light and shadow and their qualities when captured as cinematic images.

results.title: Rapt
results.brief_description:
A virtual body built from Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans of the artist’s body. MRI scans map the water content of the body to produce axial slices. These scans were used to create a 3D body accessible on any plane, making it possible to navigate through the body, and to view it internally and externally.

(Special thanks to Ray Scan Imaging and The Childrens’ Hospital Westmead Sydney)

results.title: Chain times three
results.brief_description:
As regional character disappears and corporate culture homogenizes our surroundings, it’s increasingly hard to tell where you are. Landscapes from L.A. to New Jersey, Vancouver to Melbourne, share a strange indeterminate quality. A new Wal-Mart megastore opens, somewhere, every four days. CHAIN is a multi-screen installation in CHAIN, this global, ‘superlandscape’ sets the mood and serves as mortar for a series of linked narratives and mini-documentaries that will be joined into a unique hybrid feature. CHAIN explores the effects on humans of an altered environment made not only of architecture and geography, but of the shift in economic and social horizons brought on by the increasing commercialism and surveillance that mark the ‘Age of Information’.

Cohen was in residence with ACMI during 2000. The idea for this project was developed during his time in residency.

production_dates.notes: Agreement to create the work made on 13th August 2002

results.title: Gather
results.brief_description: A restrained, observational study of the groupings, gestures, and postures of people who gather to form temporary communities in the city. People are observed gathering for entertainment, for commemoration, for debate and contestation, for celebration. The city is seen as a shifting flux and flex of momentary comminglings.

results.title: Hurt
results.creator_credit: Rhys Graham, BIG hART and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: ‘Hurt’ is an extraordinary project in which film and video cameras were put in the hands of 250 under-privileged young people from rural regions of northern New South Wales and Western Victoria. The basic materials derived from this process comprised hundreds of poignant, beautiful, cruel and comforting stories. Filmmakers Phillip Crawford and Matthew Priestly from youth arts organization BIG hART worked with the young people to create an AFI award winning film, ‘Hurt’ in which fragmented, poetic and haunting stories of isolation and hardship are told through the words and images created by the young artists. In this new ACMI commissioned project filmmakers from BIG hART have turned the material into a multi-screen spatial installation that puts the viewer into the midst of this fragmented world of broken lives, beauty and bravery.

results.title: The Fang
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Fang is an animation that uses the animated contributions of past AIM students. Produced and directed by Al MacInnes with the song performed by his band Dan and Al, the Fang celebrates and displays the vast animation techniques and styles used by Al’s peers. The Fang himself is a character around town who wonders what the fang is and discovers that he is the fang, a very much sort after man.

results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Ben McGill, David Atkinson, Robyn Blake, Bruce McGill, Jeane McGill, Sunny McGill and Jeremy Parker
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.

results.title: The Greatest story untold
results.brief_description: A short animation using both 3D claymation and 2D hand-drawn animation. A caveman wanders through the snow back to his cave and family after a hunt to find his family telling their dreams of the future. The stories differ with visions of our contemporary life, aliens kidnapping humans, and battles between good and evil.
